message: What are your favorite comic books and why?  Who are your favorite writers/artists?  What books should others add to their subscription list *right now*?
I think my fave is Greg Rucka.
It's already been pushed back twice.  It's frustrating.
My favorite series is "Y the Last Man." It blew my mind, and I'm not ashamed to say that it made me tear up in the end.
I'm also a sucker for pretty much anything Whedon.
@dustdaughter Any favorite Rucka books?
Brian K Vaughan is my favorite writer.
OMG, where do I start?  :)  I love Gotham Central and the Batwoman run he did for Detective Comics...
I love what he's done with Batwoman.
They may do a better job with sending Batwoman trades because they are hoping to sell trades to non-comic readers due to the lesbian character publicity.
@dustdaughter I've never read 10 volumes of anything as quickly as I consumed Y.
Pride of Baghdad is a great and fast read.
Just started Preacher tonight.  I will never love Garth Ennis but this story is intriguing.
Queen and Country and his WW run.
@dustdaughter Then you really need to read Y the Last Man. It's another book that could have easily been over-sexed, but instead is deeply emotional.
@dustdaughter Gail is wonderful. I love Secret Six, but I am getting a little tired of it.
BKV is great. I loved Powers.
@geekwhisperer Yeah, what is that about?
@geekwhisperer There was a bit too much press about that one aspect of the character. Detracted from the kick-assedness of the book, in some ways.
As long as they don't end up with delays like Ultimates & Ultimates 2 had, I'll be alright.
Ultimates 1 & 2 took about 5 years to release a total of about 14 issues. I started reading before college and finished my degrees around the same time it finished.
I'll blame it on the hour and not my bad memory.  Anyway, here's a link about the TV show -  http://collider.com/powers-tv-series-fx/77971/
I wish he was on the new series. We'd probably get fewer delays?
Same here. The trouble is DC is really slow with releasing trades.
Kevin Smith's "Spider-Man & Black Cat" book had something like a 5 year delay between books.
@geekwhisperer Heh.  Wow, if that happens to Batwoman, I will drop it like a bad habit.  Wait for the trade to come out in the year 2020.
Batwoman: Elegy came out pretty fast, though.
@dustdaughter He was too busy making Jersey Girl. He should have kept to the comic.
@dustdaughter Media attention rarely helps the narrative. Rucka did such a good job of not making it a fetish book, and that was upstaged by "LOOK! SHE LIKES GIRLS!!!"
@geekwhisperer Yep, that's why he's my fave writer.
I have to mention Gail Simone as well.  I think she did a great job on WW and I LOVE Birds of Prey and Secret Six.
@geekwhisperer It is definitely on my list. I've been eyeing the trades at my shop.
@dustdaughter Yeah, but the dark art and cop drama screams Rucka. It's easy to get mixed up.
@dustdaughter I read Powers a few years ago and slowly lost interest in it. It could make for good TV.
@geekwhisperer Looks like I got my Brians mixed up. Bendis wrote Powers.
Powers could succeed where Heroes failed.  If the network gives it time and a decent budget.
I would love to see GC as a TV show.  That would rock so hard.
@geekwhisperer You've read Powers, right? I heard they might make a TV series out of it.
